properties.areaDesc: Franklin, MO; Montgomery, MO; Lincoln, MO; St. Charles, MO; Calhoun, IL; Pike, MO; Pike, IL; Warren, MO
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 10 at 6:35PM CST until January 10 at 7:15PM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Calhoun County in southwestern Illinois...
Southeastern Pike County in west central Illinois...
Northwestern St. Charles County in east central Missouri...
Lincoln County in east central Missouri...
Northeastern Montgomery County in east central Missouri...
Northwestern Franklin County in east central Missouri...
Warren County in east central Missouri...
Southeastern Pike County in northeastern Missouri...

* Until 715 PM CST.

* At 635 PM CST, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes
were located along a line extending from near Bellflower to near
Jonesburg to Treloar, moving northeast at 60 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* These dangerous storms will be near...
Warrenton and Truesdale around 640 PM CST.
Wright City, Hawk Point and Innsbrook around 650 PM CST.
Troy, Moscow Mills and Davis around 655 PM CST.
Wentzville, Lake St. Louis, Eolia and Josephville around 700 PM
CST.
St. Paul, Fountain N' Lakes and Chain of Rocks around 705 PM CST.
Elsberry, Winfield and Clarksville around 710 PM CST.
Hardin and Belleview around 715 PM CST.

Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Nebo,
Whiteside, Brussels, Mozier, Batchtown, High Hill, Meppen, Olney,
Hamburg and Silex.

This also includes Cuivre River State Park.

This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 179 and 219.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

CMAMtext: NWS: TORNADO WARNING in this area til 7:15 PM CST. Take shelter now. Check media.
